attributes.action: Put into action a policy or scheme to help save the Pubs of England.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Pubs go right back to the origins of England and the English.
In the original English Anglo-Saxon times, from the late 6th century onwards there were Mead Hall and Chieftain Huts, which were the original Pubs basically. 
Mead - a honey based alcohol was drank in them and stories were told in them.
They eventually became known as pubs, as we know them today.
They were and still are the community centres of the English, and are now being closed at the rate of two a day!
We English ask the British Government to help revive the English Pub by putting into effect a policy or scheme that will help revive the Pub and Brewery industry.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
